page.title: 01ROTHIESHOLM HEAD
page.content: Rothiesholm Head is practically all covered in heather but there is some cultivated land and rough grazing. There are quite a few peat banks on the Head. Peats are cut from the banks then are left to dry and are then collected. Peats are like a substitute for coal, but many people use both coal and peat. It is a Stronsay tradition that only the people who live in Rothiesholm can take peats from the banks. There is a loch called Stranie Water which is said to be bottomless but it is more likely that it has a sinking bottom from the peats.
